alert.note: Alert for Effingham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:17PM EDT until May 03 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF EFFINGHAM...HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 617 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Varnville to near Garnett, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Hampton, Yemassee, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Furman, Scotia, Luray, Crocketville, Lena, Tarboro, Miley, Grays, Garnett and Pineland. This warning includes I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 35 and 41. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
